NonoPic is a puzzle game based on nonograms.\n\nThe objective is to reveal a picture by following the patterns of the numbers next to the columns and rows of the grid.

Each number indicates the number of consecutive ticked boxes in each row or column.\n\nFor example, a 5 above a column means that somewhere in that column there is a group of five ticked boxes with no spaces between them.

If there is more than one number for a row or column, it means that there are multiple groups of cells, separated by at least one blank cell.\n\nIn the image you can see a case where a 2 and a 7 appear for the same row.
You will have to use logic to work out which boxes to tick and which not to tick.\n\nDo not forget to mark with an X the boxes that you know cannot be ticked!
